poem:
### Kilmar's Custody

In Tennessee's sun-blind cell,  
Kilmar's shadow grows—  
untouched by law's cold grasp.  
  
A journey, boundless,  
between bars unseen,  
where innocence stands tall,  
a silent emblem,  
whispering freedom  
through steel and sorrow;  
among whispers,  
hope unravels—  
absurdity's harsh cloak sways.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The case against Kilmar Ábrego García is a study in sadistic absurdity | Moira Donegan In a way, you could think of the brief stint that Kilmar Ábrego García spent in a Tennessee jail after his return from a Salvadorian prison camp in June as a kind of protective custody. Ábrego, a Maryland resident who had never been charged with any crime either in the US or in his native El Salvador, became a symbol". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
